snippet: A rule had required parents to sign a consent form before metzitzah b’peh, a ritual in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community that has been linked to herpes infections in infants.
abstract: New York City Board of Health repeals rule requiring parental consent forms for controversial circumcision ritual practiced by ultra-Orthodox Jews; risk of herpes transmission through ritual remains, but some board members who were previously in favor of forms have changed position due to city's strained relationship with Orthodox community.
lead_paragraph: A rule had required parents to sign a consent form before metzitzah b’peh, a ritual in the ultra-Orthodox Jewish community that has been linked to herpes infections in infants.

headline.main: New York City Health Board Repeals Rule on Consent Forms for Circumcision Ritual
headline.print_headline: City Repeals Rule Requiring Circumcision Consent Forms
